tweet: Nearly $200,000 has been awarded to @unetweets to increase telehealth capabilities in response to COVID-19. This funding will help UNE reach seniors in rural communities by providing medical professionals with the telemedicine tools they need to safely care for their patients.

COVID-19 has made it challenging for seniors & low-income families to travel to purchase food. @SenAngusKing & I joined a bipartisan group of our colleagues in calling on the USDA to further expand delivery & curbside pickup options for SNAP participants during this pandemic. https://t.co/CkgmkKRaRn

The Senate passed a bill to ensure families of first responders who have lost their lives to COVID-19 can access survivor benefits without facing unnecessary hurdles. First responders are working selflessly to keep our communities safe, & we must protect & care for their families https://t.co/VfgPBy2ytF

May is Lyme Disease Awareness Month. With more people spending time outdoors due to COVID-19, I urge everyone to take precautions to protect against tick-borne diseases. The Tick Act, a new law I wrote, will help by providing $150 million to fight ticks.

https://t.co/TKmzv1nEdR

The Postal Service is the linchpin of the mailing industry & the focal point of many rural communities. @SenFeinstein & I led a bipartisan group calling for relief for USPS & additional safety protections for employees in the next COVID-19 package.

https://t.co/ftq6xGJ7M6

Helping people with diabetes manage the disease & avoid hospitalization is always a top priority, & it is even more important during this pandemic. During the COVID-19 pandemic, there may be increased risk for elder abuse. To help protect seniors, @SenatorMenendez, @ChuckGrassley, & I introduced a bill to help provide professionals with training for cases where the victim or a witness has Alzheimer’s. https://t.co/n8eYvSHKPd

On a Zoom conference call this morning, @GovJanetMills & the Maine delegation discussed our ongoing joint efforts to combat COVID-19 & the threat it poses to the health of our citizens & communities. We will continue to work closely together to advocate on behalf of all Mainers.

Today, I'm joining a bipartisan group in introducing the SMART Act - a $500 billion rescue package for state & local governments hurt by COVID-19. 

Under our bill, Maine would receive at least $2 billion, which builds on the $1.25 billion we received from the CARES Act.

I have long been a strong advocate for the Inspectors General.  They are vital partners in Congress’s effort to identify inefficient or ineffective government programs and to root out fraud and other wrongdoing.
According to the @AP, a Census Bureau survey showed that nearly 2/3 of small businesses in Maine have received forgivable PPP loans, among the highest in the nation.

To help protect & support Maine employers like @LLBean, @husseyseating, and Rogers Collection, I wrote to Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin today, calling on him to temporarily defer tariffs for U.S. companies that are experiencing economic hardship during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/ECKppOruaM

I am saddened by the passing of my friend and former colleague, Tom Coburn of Oklahoma. Tom was a man of deep faith and strong convictions who cared deeply for his family and our country. May God bless his wife Carolyn and daughters during this difficult time and always.

I extend my deepest condolences to the family and friends of the Mainer who passed away from COVID-19.  A difficult road lies ahead for our state.  We are resilient, and we will get through this crisis together.
